p: The total number of invasive species found in individual plots varied from 0 to 3. A total of 792 plots contained one invasive species, 427 plots contained two invasive species, and only nine plots contained three ( S1 Table). As predicted, disturbance by humans increased the probability of invasion and the inclusion of land-use history significantly improved model fit (LR Χ 2 = 28.50, df = 5, p < 0.001). However, the species count was significantly higher than in the always forested sites in only two land-use categories: agriculture to forest (log count = 0.28, z = 5.024, p < 0.001) and mined (log count = 0.23, z = 2.309, p = 0.021; Fig 2). Inclusion of distance to road did not improve model fit (LR Χ 2 = 0.36, df = 1, p = 0.55).
